holidays.name: Singles' Day
holidays.description: Originally a Chinese unofficial holiday celebrating single people, Singles' Day has transformed into the world's largest online shopping extravaganza, surpassing Black Friday with insane sales and deals.
holidays.origin: Began in the 1990s among students in China as a day to celebrate being single; popularized commercially by Alibaba in the 2000s.
holidays.funFact: On Singles' Day, Alibaba once raked in sales exceeding $30 billion in just 24 hours!

holidays.name: Origami Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the traditional Japanese art of paper folding, Origami Day encourages creativity and precision by transforming flat sheets of paper into intricate shapes and figures.
holidays.origin: Japan; the exact origin is unclear, but the day is recognized to promote this beautiful craft worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Did you know? The word 'origami' comes from 'ori' meaning folding, and 'kami' meaning paper.

holidays.name: National French Dip Day
holidays.description: Celebrate this delicious sandwich featuring thinly sliced roast beef dipped in savory au jus. It's a carnivore's delight and a lesser-known but beloved American food holiday.
holidays.origin: The French dip sandwich was reportedly invented in Los Angeles in the early 1900s, with claims from multiple eateries about its origin.
holidays.funFact: Contrary to what the name suggests, the sandwich isn‚Äôt French ‚Äî it‚Äôs an American invention named for the style of sandwich rather than nationality.

holidays.name: Veterans Day (U.S.)
holidays.description: A federal holiday dedicated to honoring military veterans who served in the United States Armed Forces. Though solemn, many quirky celebrations and parades happen nationwide.
holidays.origin: Originally Armistice Day, marking the end of World War I on November 11, 1918; renamed Veterans Day in 1954 to honor all U.S. veterans.
holidays.funFact: November 11 was chosen because the armistice ending WWI went into effect on the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month.
